result.execSummary:
The defendant Christopher J Paulos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid as a condition of probation.

Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.  No use or possession of alcohol or illegal drugs/drug paraphernalia. Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety. No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription. Valid prescriptions only with prior agent approval and to be taken only in the manner they are ordered. Sign releases for agent.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Probation may terminate after 6 Months if deemed appropriate by agent. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Follow through with any treatment or counseling recommended by agent. 
**Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided,   immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: To be completed as a condition of probation, as directed by agent.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Christopher J Paulos in court with Attorney Jennifer Flynn for Attorney Jessica L. Rowe.  Susan L. Opper appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count #1.  Court performs plea colloquy and finds Defendant guilty of Count #1.  Count #2 is dismissed and read-in.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Flynn makes statements regarding sentencing.  Defendant makes statements.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  1 YEAR   - may terminate after 6 months if deemed appropriate by agent

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
____No Use or Possession of illegal drugs 
____No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
____Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are 
prescribed/sign releases.
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
____20 Hours of Community Service
____Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent 

COSTS:  $243.00 & $200.00 DNA surcharge (to be paid as a condition of probation)

** Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.**

*Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.*
(Fax) Dated 04/26/16, from Atty Rowe, with attached documents for plea/sentencing hearing.
2 counseling letters filed by Attorney Rowe

Attorney Jessica L. Rowe in court.   Defendant Christopher J Paulos did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rowe requests a plea and sentence date.  Court sets plea and sentence date.   Bail remains as fixed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for April 28, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Jessica L. Rowe in court.   Defendant Christopher J Paulos did not appear.   Shawn N Woller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Rowe requests an adjournment to further review discovery and so Defendant can enroll in treatment.  Court adjourns.   Bail remains as fixed.  Hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.
Supplemental Demand for Discovery and Inspection. Filed by Atty Rowe.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant not to discuss the case with any witnesses listed in the criminal complaint.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.

Defendant Christopher J Paulos in court with attorney Jessica L. Rowe.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for December 22, 2015 at 08:30 am.
